intro: Vellozia pinifolia, commonly known as the pineleaf vellozia, is a unique member of the Restionaceae family native to South Africa. It is characterized by its needle-like leaves that resemble pine needles, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowering stems produce small, clustered inflorescences with white or pale pink flowers. Vellozia pinifolia is often found in fynbos vegetation and is known for its ornamental value and ecological significance.
